title: (SCTP) Digital Product Management Programme | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: A 3+ month programme covering digital product management, agile methods, UX design, and metrics, preparing you for CSPO certification.

text_lines: Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
A 3+ month programme covering digital product management, agile methods, UX design, and metrics, preparing you for CSPO certification.
Up to 95% SkillsFuture Funding, and eligible for SkillsFuture Credit (Mid-Career Support) of S$4,000*.
*For Singapore Citizens aged 40 years and above.
Up to $3,000 monthly SkillsFuture Mid-Career Training Allowance
As technology evolves rapidly, skilled digital product managers are essential for staying abreast of trends and making data-driven decisions to optimise product performance.
Their focus on exceptional user experiences and customer-centric solutions will help businesses maintain a competitive edge in the digital domain.

This programme provides a comprehensive understanding of core concepts and practices in digital product management. It aims to equip learners with the skills to bring successful digital products to life, from ideation to execution.

Digital product managers guide iterative processes in agile development environments and foster cross-functional collaboration. They are crucial in identifying market opportunities and validating product ideas to ensure a strong product-market fit. As such, learners will be trained in product management principles and develop a customer-centric approach to product strategy and development by mastering skills for market research, user experience (UX) design, and product roadmap creation. They will also be exposed to the best practices for agile product development methodologies.

Learners will apply their knowledge in a practical setting through a Capstone Project. By the end of the course, they will acquire the skills to measure and determine relevant key metrics for product success using analytics. They will also be prepared for the Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO) certification, equipping them with essential knowledge for effective product management and agile practices.
Individuals with business, commercial or technology-related experience looking to pivot into a career in digital product management for roles such as:
Individuals should possess a relevant background, which may include:
A minimum of a Diploma; or
Relevant work experience in technology-related job roles; or
Prior or current work experience in sales, commercial management, business development, marketing, or product management
Module 1: Introduction to Digital Product Management
Explain the role of a digital product manager by identifying key responsibilities and functions within the product development process
Apply knowledge of the product lifecycle by outlining the stages from ideation to launch, and creating action plans for each stage
Utilise digital product manager's toolkit to implement effective strategies for managing digital products throughout the lifecycle
Module 2: Consumer Market Research and Analysis
Apply market research techniques to define target markets and unveil customer needs and wants
Utilise competitive intelligence to analyse market trends, and craft a comprehensive market research plan
Translate quantitative and qualitative data into actionable insights to validate product concepts, and build compelling case for product development
Create a compelling value proposition by defining the target audience and articulating a clear product vision
Design a product roadmap that prioritises features effectively and aligns with the business model and user acquisition strategy
Develop relevant metrics and KPIs to assess product performance and associated risks to develop effective mitigation strategies
Module 4: User Experience and Product Design
Apply user-centric design principles to create products that meet the needs and preferences of users
Organise content effectively to enhance user flow by implementing information architecture best practices
Analyse user feedback from testing sessions to uncover usability issues and improve product design iteratively
Evaluate design elements such as visual storytelling and micro-interactions to create inclusive and engaging user experiences
Module 5: Agile Scrum Methodology for Digital Products
Apply the Scrum framework to facilitate effective sprint planning and adopt an agile mindset for project success
Implement iterative development practices to ensure continuous delivery and responsiveness to user feedback
Analyse user testing and feedback to identify areas for improvement and enhance the overall product experience
Evaluate progress and performance metrics during sprint retrospectives to drive continuous improvement and refine Agile processes
Create a detailed marketing strategy and launch calendar that effectively aligns with product objectives and target audience needs
Develop a comprehensive distribution plan that establishes optimal channels for product reach and accessibility
Design a pricing strategy and revenue model that supports the product’s market positioning and financial goals
Craft engaging promotional campaigns and manage public relations efforts to generate pre-launch buzz and maximise product visibility
Create a comprehensive GTM strategy that includes marketing tactics, distribution channels, and pricing for a new digital product launch
Develop and execute promotional campaigns and public relations efforts to generate pre-launch buzz and enhance visibility
Evaluate the product launch's effectiveness by tracking performance metrics and assessing marketing strategy impact
Analyse launch feedback and results to refine the digital product strategy and prepare a presentation for potential employers or clients
Senior Product Manager, IBM Consulting Singapore
Senior Product Manager, IBM Consulting Singapore

Jeffrey Chai is seasoned product leader who has extensive experience in leading innovation and transformation across both government and industry sectors. At IBM Consulting Singapore, he leads the best practices for the design, development and delivery of enterprise data and artificial intelligence products, each aligning their strategies with client needs to create lasting business impacts.

Formerly a product manager at GovTech Singapore and the Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore, Jeffrey has successfully managed data products that drive national digital transformation, including AI-enabled platforms and hybrid cloud solutions. His work emphasises on user-centricity, agile execution, and data-informed innovation.

An advocate for lifelong learning and industry relevance, Jeffrey is also a certified Product Owner, Scrum Master and holds multiple graduate-level credentials in Product Management, Business Analytics, and even a Masters in Business Administration. As a trainer, he is passionate about equipping professionals with the mindset, tools, and strategies needed to thrive in the digital product space.

Wei Liang is a product strategist and innovation educator with a decade of experience helping ventures and organisations across Southeast Asia bring meaningful ideas to market. With deep roots in entrepreneurship, he specialises in guiding teams from zero to one—crafting products that solve real problems, resonate with users, built to scale and commercialised.

Wei Liang has partnered with governments, global universities, family enterprises, and corporations to design programmes that bridge product development, market entry, and business transformation. From leading accelerators to building next-gen leadership pipelines, he is known for blending rigorous strategy with practical execution—delivering results that are both measurable and meaningful.

Wei Liang’s strength lies in seeing the full picture: from uncovering user needs to mapping business models, launching MVPs, and aligning cross-functional teams around growth. He is often sought after for his clarity of thought, influence across sectors, and his ability to activate innovation from the ground up.

Currently completing a Doctorate in Business Administration focused on entrepreneurial pedagogy, Wei Liang is shaping the future of how product strategy and innovation capability are built—both in startups and established organisations. His work continues to inspire founders, operators, and executives to not only build better products, but to lead with purpose and clarity in a world that demands constant reinvention.

Ren Sen is an AI product manager with a background in designing and deploying AI-enabled digital products. His journey spans diverse domains, including software engineering, digital product management, and intelligent systems. Starting from developing AI chatbots for customer service, Ren Sen has consistently explored how artificial intelligence can enhance in other business functions, establishing himself as a leader in creating impactful, user-centric products.

Ren Sen’s career began with early Silicon Valley startups, providing him with first-hand exposure to high-growth environments. This entrepreneurial foundation cultivated his problem-solving skills, which he later applied at Singapore’s leading organisations to enhance customer experiences and operational efficiency. As he transitioned into the corporate world, he specialised in designing and scaling intelligent digital assistants and platforms.

His experience spans the lifecycle of AI-powered products, from concept and natural language design to deployment and continuous iteration. He has developed frameworks to ensure quality, safety, and compliance of AI outputs, and led agile teams with scrum, ensuring that complex products are delivered on time and aligned with strategic outcomes.

Ren Sen holds a Master of Computing in Information Systems and a Bachelor of Computing in Electronic Commerce (Honours with Distinction) from the National University of Singapore. His academic journey also includes the NUS Overseas College (Silicon Valley) programme. He is also a certified product management and agile professional, dedicated to lifelong learning and staying at the forefront of digital innovation.
Classes are held once a week for 13 weeks:
Classes are held online twice a week from 7:00 pm – 10:00 pm for 13 weeks, over three months
Asynchronous e-Learning with research and reading materials
Capstone project, self-learning with project consultation and final project presentation
A Certificate of Attainment will be issued to participants who:
Attend at least 75% of the course
Undertake and pass non-credit bearing assessment during the course
Participants who meet the attendance requirement but do not pass the assessment will receive a Certificate of Participation.
The full fee for this course is S$14,170.00.
Funded under SkillsFuture Mid-Career Enhanced Subsidy (MCES)
Singapore Citizen who meets the additional course fee funding support criteria*
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.
Additional Course Fee Funding Support Criteria
To be eligible for 95% additional course fee funding support, applicants must be a Singapore Citizen and meet one of the following criteria:
Long-term unemployed individual (unemployed for six months or more); or
Person with disabilities; or Individual in need of financial assistance – ComCare Short-to-Medium Term Assistance (SMTA) recipient or
Workfare Income Supplement (WIS) recipient. Additionally, they should not have received any other funding from government sources in respect of the actual grant disbursed for the programme.
Learners may also use their SkillsFuture Credit and Additional SkillsFuture Credit (Mid-Career Support) to further offset out-of-pocket course fees.
Singapore Citizens, aged 40 and above, are eligible for Training Allowance amount of 50% of your average income over the latest available 12-month period, capped at $3,000 per month.

The SCTP is open to all Singapore Citizens and Permanent Residents, particularly mid-career individuals looking to transition to new sectors or job roles. Both employed and unemployed individuals are eligible.
What is the duration of a SCTP at SITLEARN?
The duration of a SCTP at SIT
typically ranges from four to six months, depending on the specific programme and its requirements.
Will the programme lead to job placements for me?

While our SCTP provides career advisory and employment facilitation services to help you in your job search, it does not guarantee job placements. You are encouraged to be proactive and open to job opportunities available.
Will I need to have certain minimum academic qualifications to sign up for the SCTP?
Minimum academic qualifications may be required for some SCTPs. You will be assessed by our SIT
admission and review committee on your suitability for our programme prior to enrolment.
Can I take up another course under the SCTP if I have not managed to find a job after completing a course?
Yes, you can take up another SCTP if you have not managed to find a job after completing a course. However, your suitability for the new course will be assessed by SIT
Do I need to pay the full amount of course fees first then receive SkillsFuture Funding after?
No, you do not need to pay the full amount of course fees upfront. Different tier of SkillsFuture Funding is applied directly to the course fees, reducing the amount you need to pay out-of-pocket.
Can I use my SkillsFuture Credit and additional SkillsFuture Credit (Mid-Career Support) to offset the out-of-pocket course fees payable?
Yes, you can use your SkillsFuture Credit and additional SkillsFuture Credit (Mid-Career Support) to offset the out-of-pocket course fees payable for SCTP.
Can I attend 2 SCTP programmes concurrently?
No. You cannot enrol in two SCTP programmes at the same time, whether full-time or part-time, if they overlap. You must complete one SCTP before starting another.
Can I re-attend the same SCTP programme that I have completed previously?
No. You cannot re-attend the same SCTP programme you have completed previously.
How do I know if I qualify for SkillsFuture Course Fees Funding Support?
Singapore Citizens, Permanent Residents and LTVP+ holders are eligible for SkillsFuture Course Fees Funding Support on SkillsFuture supported courses.
If I fail the programme or drop out, what will happen to the funding I’ve received?

If you fail the programme or drop out without a valid reason, you may be required to refund the course fee subsidy you received. Trainees are encouraged to complete all modules and pass the assessments to fully benefit from the programme and retain the funding support.
What if I turn 40 years old in the middle of the programme?
If you turn 40 years old during the programme, you will become eligible for the Mid-Career Enhanced Subsidy from the month you turn 40. This subsidy can cover up to 90% of programme fees.
Who is eligible for SkillsFuture Mid-Career Training Allowance?
Singapore Citizens aged 40 years old and above are eligible for SkillsFuture Mid-Career Training Allowance when they enrol into full-time TA Elgiible SCTPs.
When do I apply for SkillsFuture Mid-Career Training Allowance?
You can submit your Training Allowance application up to three (3) months before the programme start date.
Can I be employed and still be eligible for the SkillsFuture Mid-Career Training Allowance when enrolling into a full-time SCTP?

You can be employed and still apply for the Training Allowance for an eligible full-time training programme. Individuals must meet the full-time training intensity and programme requirements each month in order to receive the monthly payout.
How do I know how many months of SkillsFuture Mid-Career Training Allowance payout I will receive for the application?

The maximum eligible period in the application refers to the maximum number of months you can receive for the Training Allowance. The actual number of months you will receive for the Training Allowance depends on the actual course duration and fulfilment of the training requirements each month.
How is my monthly TA computed?
It is computed based on the latest available 12 months of income data from Government records (E.g CPF Board, IRAS) as of course start date.
What if my course has been deferred or cancelled?
Your TA application will be cancelled, and you will need to re-submit a TA application where your SCTP enrolment will be treated as a new SCTP enrolment.
What are the programme requirements I need to fulfil in order to receive the monthly training allowances?
You will need to fulfil a minimum of 75% attendance of trainer led sessions for each of the training month of the programme.
Meet Joe Leong: Your Career Coach

Joe Leong is a dedicated and experienced career coach specialising in helping mid-career professionals navigate their career transitions and up-level their skills. With a strong background in career development and a passion for empowering individuals, Joe has successfully guided numerous professionals towards achieving their career goals.
Interested in this course for your business or team?
Tailored to your organisation's specific training needs, we can help you design and develop custom courses to grow key talent and build specialist expertise to meet the future demands of work.
is the lifelong learning division of the Singapore Institute of Technology, Singapore's first University of Applied Learning. SIT
is dedicated to providing high-quality, industry-relevant training and education to professionals and mid-career individuals. Through its innovative Applied Learning approach, SIT
equips learners with practical skills and knowledge that are directly applicable in the workplace, helping them stay competitive in the evolving job market.
There are no upcoming course runs at the moment.

We look forward to journeying with you on your path of lifelong learning. You can manage your preferences or unsubscribe at any time through the links provided in our communications. To learn more about how SIT protects your personal data, you may refer to SIT's Personal Data Protection Policy
